_description: Verses on Pride, Envy, and Wrath — three quatrains

BLHar957.First Lines: Prid man I þe forbedeif þou be god and feyr and wis…
BLHar957.Last Lines: …If it beleue yt sal be [    ] þatþou sal baþe fraist and fanday
BLHar957.Note: Written two lines of verse per line in the manuscript; “Superbia,” “Inuidia,” and “Ira” written in left margin beside each pair of double lines.
BLHar957.Editions:
Wright,  Thomas,  and  James Orchard Halliwell-Phillipps, eds.  
             Reliquiae Antiquae.
         2 vols. London: Smith, 1845: 1.260.
